title: Banking & Finance: Tech Buyout Firm Sets a $250 Million Goal for First Fund
text:
Cuadrilla's co-founders previously worked together at private-equity firm Marlin Equity Partners in Hermosa Beach, Calif.

Jonah Sulak, a co-founder and managing partner, spent more than 12 years at Marlin. By April 2019, when he stepped back from his role, Mr. Sulak was a managing director and investment committee member for the firm's Heritage funds, which invest in lower midmarket software and technology companies. He remained a senior adviser to the firm until leaving in December that year, according to his LinkedIn page.

Mr. Sulak was joined last month by Marlin alums Vikram Abraham, as co-founder and managing partner, and Michael Richards as a co-founder and principal. Mr. Abraham worked at Marlin for more than two years before joining Clearlake Capital in 2017 and Mr. Richards worked at the firm for more than five years until October 2019, according to their LinkedIn pages.

Cuadrilla will take controlling or minority positions in lower midmarket, subscription-based enterprise software companies that have $8 million to $28 million of annual recurring revenue, according to its website.

The California firm plans to back software-as-a-service providers that are profitable or have reached break-even results, its website said. Cuadrilla also seeks to invest in early stage companies that are nearing the break-even point, the website said.

The new fund is being marketed by placement firm Pacenote Capital, sources said.

Pacenote and Cuadrilla didn't respond to messages seeking comment on the fundraising effort.
